Definition: In this task, you are given a tuple consisting of a Head and a Tail event, separated by <sep>. The Head and Tail events are short phrases involving one or more participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX will be seen as mentioned in the Tail. In this task, PersonX will be seen as mentioned in the Tail if the Tail describes PersonX's persona or attribute as perceived by others given an event. For example, if the event is PersonX gives a gift, PersonX may be seen as generous or giving. In contrast, if the event is PersonX steals a car, PersonX may be perceived as evil. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense
